items.title: “We, I think, all need to look deep into ourselves and ask...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

“We, I think, all need to look deep into ourselves and ask ourselves why we let a system like this continue to function and continue to thrive, and why it’s received so little attention in the past,” Flood said.

items.title: Tuesday Olson knew her pregnancy was in trouble and tried to...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

Tuesday Olson knew her pregnancy was in trouble and tried to access hospital care as soon as possible. But there was a problem: she was in jail. Thousands of people arrive to jails pregnant each year. At a minimum, they deserve access to medical attention. Learn more about Tuesday's story at: https://aclu-co.org/repro-stories/

Every pregnancy is different, but there are tell-tale signs that something may not be right. Pregnant people know that cramping, bleeding, and intense abdominal pain may be a cause for concern. When Tuesday Olson started experiencing these symptoms, she knew … Continue reading →

aclu-co.org

Repro Stories | ACLU of Colorado

Every pregnancy is different, but there are tell-tale signs that something may not be right. Pregnant people know that cramping, bleeding, and intense abdominal pain may be a cause for concern. items.title: The number of women inside America’s jails is up more than 20%...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

The number of women inside America’s jails is up more than 20% this past decade. That's about more than 115,000 incarcerated women a day. Many arrive in need of medical attention, some with serious health conditions without access to proper care. Thousands who are jailed each year are pregnant.

As the number of women in U.S. jails has risen, so have deaths and medical errors in facilities ill-equipped to handle this growing population.

reuters.com

As more women fill America’s jails, medical tragedies mount

As the number of women in U.S. jails has risen, so have deaths and medical errors in facilities ill-equipped to handle this growing population.As the number of women in U.S. jails has risen, so have deaths and medical errors in facilities ill-equipped to handle this growing population.

items.title: Únase a nosotros para la proyección de estreno de "The...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

Únase a nosotros para la proyección de estreno de "The Facility", un documental que destaca los horribles abusos y la negligencia que ocurren dentro del centro de detención de inmigrantes GEO en Aurora. Ex detenidos, familias que luchan por reunirse y defensores se unen para compartir sus experiencias de primera mano con el centro de detención en nuestro patio.
El documental se proyectará en inglés y español con servicios de interpretación.
RSVP: https://aclu-co.org/the-facility/

items.title: Join us for the premiere screening of "The Facility,"...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

Join us for the premiere screening of "The Facility," a short documentary film that highlights the horrific abuses and neglect happening inside the GEO immigration detention facility in Aurora. Former detainees, families fighting to be reunited, and advocates come together to share their first-hand experiences with the for-profit detention facility in our backyard.

RSVP: https://aclu-co.org/the-facility/

items.title: A woman who is 3 months pregnant, held for a non-violent...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

A woman who is 3 months pregnant, held for a non-violent offense, wrote, “Even though I had tested negative & even though I am high risk because I am pregnant & have asthma, the jail still did nothing to move me away from the people who tested positive.”

A class-action lawsuit has been filed against El Paso County Sheriff for deliberately denying masks and COVID-19 protections to incarcerated people.

koaa.com

ACLU files lawsuit against El Paso County sheriff for denying masks and COVID-19 protections to people in jail

A class-action lawsuit has been filed against El Paso County Sheriff for deliberately denying masks and COVID-19 protections to incarcerated people.A class-action lawsuit has been filed against El Paso County Sheriff for deliberately denying masks and COVID-19 protections to incarcerated people.

items.title: “While publicly on Facebook Sheriff Elder was imploring...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

“While publicly on Facebook Sheriff Elder was imploring citizens to ‘wear a mask,’ privately he and his staff prohibited people from wearing masks in their housing units,” said Mark Silverstein, ACLU of Colorado legal director. El Paso County Jail failed to supply masks to people being held there until November 1, too late to stop the ongoing outbreak inside the facility.

ACLU of Colorado and three private attorneys on Sunday filed a class action lawsuit against El Paso County Sheriff Bill Elder in federal court, alleging that the El Paso County Jail didn’t comply with COVID-19 public health guidelines, even as more than 800 prisoners tested positive for the virus.

kdvr.com

ACLU sues El Paso County sheriff over failure to comply with COVID guidelines | KDVR FOX31

ACLU of Colorado and three private attorneys on Sunday filed a class action lawsuit against El Paso County Sheriff Bill Elder in federal court, alleging that the El Paso County Jail didn’t comply with COVID-19 public health guidelines, even as more than 800 prisoners tested positive for the virus.ACLU of Colorado and three private attorneys on Sunday filed a class action lawsuit against El Paso County Sheriff Bill Elder in federal court, alleging that the El Paso County Jail didn’t comply with COVID-19 public health guidelines, even as more than 800 prisoners tested positive for the virus.

items.title: The El Paso County Sheriff failed to follow public health...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

The El Paso County Sheriff failed to follow public health guidance and spent federal money on office renovations rather than protections for the people in his care, resulting in the largest COVID-19 outbreak of any jail or prison in the state.

The ACLU of Colorado filed a class action lawsuit in federal court to improve COVID-19 protections for incarcerated people at El Paso.

coloradonewsline.com

ACLU files federal lawsuit against El Paso County sheriff over COVID protections for jail inmates - Colorado Newsline

The ACLU of Colorado filed a class action lawsuit in federal court to improve COVID-19 protections for incarcerated people at El Paso.The ACLU of Colorado filed a class action lawsuit in federal court to improve COVID-19 protections for incarcerated people at El Paso.

items.title: "In the time it took to prepare to file this case, people...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

"In the time it took to prepare to file this case, people who tested negative multiple times have now tested positive and begun to get sick. Urgent is an understatement," said Dan Williams, an attorney on the case. The majority of the people in the jail at the time of the outbreak couldn’t afford to pay their way out and hadn’t yet been convicted of a crime.

Inmates at the El Paso County jail filed a class action lawsuit against the sheriff in charge of the facility alleging jail staff put their lives at risk by not providing masks and failed to proper…

Inmates sue El Paso County jail for failing to provide masks, alleging lack of COVID-19 precautions

items.title: “The Facility” is a short documentary film chronicling the...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

“The Facility” is a short documentary film chronicling the lived experiences of immigrants being held at the GEO detention facility in Aurora, Colorado. This film addresses the personal loss and consequences caused by for-profit detention and the federal government's broken immigration policies. Legal and medical experts highlight horrific abuses including death, medical neglect, nutrition issues, and prolonged detention during the coronavirus pandemic. To tell their stories, current and former detainees, families fighting to be reunited, and advocates come together to share their experiences behind the walls of the GEO immigration detention facility in Aurora.

Sign up for the premiere screening on Dec. 18: https://aclu.zoom.us/web…/register/WN_nUbTy8-VQpif8nMzqtUzQw

items.title: More than 160 staff and 1,000 people held at El Paso County Jail...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

More than 160 staff and 1,000 people held at El Paso County Jail have contracted COVID-19. Inadequate mask distribution, nearly nonexistent quarantining efforts, mixing healthy and infected people, and other blunders have led to the worst outbreak any jail or prison in Colorado has ever seen. This year, El Paso County Sheriff received $15.6 million specifically to enact COVID-19 protections for incarcerated people and staff. Instead, this money was mismanaged and spent on unrelated renovations. On Sunday, we filed a lawsuit to protect people inside the jail, including getting more than one mask per person and enacting legitimate quarantining methods.

https://aclu-co.org/aclu-and-civil-rights-attorneys-file-c…/

items.title: BREAKING: The El Paso County jail failed to protect incarcerated...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

BREAKING: The El Paso County jail failed to protect incarcerated people from COVID-19 for months, denying masks and dismissing CDC guidelines. Staff told people begging for help: “we’re just going to let the virus run its course." Yesterday, we sued.

December 14, 2020 DENVER – As COVID-19 raged throughout Colorado jails and prisons, and more than 800 detainees at the El Paso County Jail tested positive for the virus, jail staff told incarcerated people begging for help: “we’re just going … Continue reading →

items.title: COVID-19 is spreading like wildfire in our jails and prisons but...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

COVID-19 is spreading like wildfire in our jails and prisons but Gov. Polis is ignoring the risks and disregarding guidance from CDPHE and the American Medical Association, which recommends vaccine priority to people living in communal settings — especially jails and prisons. The Governor's failure to safely reduce jail and prison populations in Colorado and this cruel change to the distribution plan puts all of us at risk.

Vaccinations for the first group of Coloradans will begin within weeks.

cpr.org

Who Will Get The First Doses Of Colorado Coronavirus Vaccines?

Vaccinations for the first group of Coloradans will begin within weeks.Vaccinations for the first group of Coloradans will begin within weeks.

items.title: “Aurora can’t run as though paying out these settlements is...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

“Aurora can’t run as though paying out these settlements is just the cost of doing business – the cost of running a city. These settlements need to be propelling Aurora to change the police department,” said Mark Silverstein, Legal Director of ACLU of Colorado.

The City of Aurora has paid out more than a quarter of a million dollars to settle a police brutality lawsuit filed in 2018.

kdvr.com

City of Aurora settles federal police brutality case for $285K

The City of Aurora has paid out more than a quarter of a million dollars to settle a police brutality lawsuit filed in 2018.The City of Aurora has paid out more than a quarter of a million dollars to settle a police brutality lawsuit filed in 2018.

items.title: Racialized policing in Aurora is an epidemic, and real people...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

Racialized policing in Aurora is an epidemic, and real people and lives are forever altered as a result of excessive use of force by police. Alberto Torres is one of many survivors of police brutality whose story must be told and learned from as we work toward safer policing and accountability.

The ACLU of Colorado announced Thursday it has reached a $285,000 settlement with the city of Aurora in a lawsuit over officers’ investigation of a noise complaint that ended with

items.title: We need a different vision of community safety, one that does...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

We need a different vision of community safety, one that does not include over-policing our Black and Brown neighbors with excessive force, humiliation or death. Demand Aurora police to redirect resources to positive, community-driven solutions that promote the dignity and safety that all Aurora residents deserve. https://action.aclu.org/send-message/co-divest-invest
